intro: Conceveiba martiana, commonly known as the Martiana Conceveiba, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and lobed, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
